content.description:
P1. Begin by climbing the low angle corner to a smallÂ overhang (crux.) Climb past it and continue up a series of ramps and corners to a bolted belay next to a left facing corner. 5.10b

P2. From the belay, traverse left and climb the bolted face to a two bolt anchor below a large roof. A great and exciting pitch! 5.10c/d
content.protection: Bolts, bolted anchors. Bring a few small cams to protect some of the runouts between bolts, especially on the second pitch.
content.location: This climb is located below and to the left of a large roof in the middle of the Asylum wall. Find the low angle corner with a bolt about 15ft up

content.description:
This is a second pitch variation of Welcome to The Asylum.

From the P1 anchors, traverse right and climb the bolted face to a two bolt belay. Harder than it looks.

This pitch is over 30m long, so you'll need either a 70m rope or two ropes to get back to the ground.
content.location: At the P1 belay of Welcome to the Asylum, traverse right and follow the line of bolts.

climbs.name: Electroshock Therapy
climbs.fa: B. Thau, H. Laeger, M. Krebs - 12/11/2016

content.description:
Located just left of Welcome to the Asylum, this climb follows a series of cracks, shallow corners, and ramps to the top of the wall. The highlight is the second pitch, where wide crack climbing skills are mandatory if you want to send.

P1. Begin at a shallow corner with a bolt about 10ft up. continue past three more bolts to a pair of bolted anchors on a large, vegetated ledge. 5.10-

P2. From the anchors, Bushwhack to the base of the wide crack and jam your way up, using a combination of hands and fists. After negotiating the crack, continue up an easy but polished ramp to another set of bolted anchors. 5.10

P3. Climb up to the base of a large flake. Be careful here as there is some loose rock than can be tricky to avoid. After pulling through the flake, follow three bolts to the top of the wall. 5.10-
content.protection:
Single rack from tiny to 4.5 inches.

Rap with a 70m rope. A 60m will not reach
content.location: 10ft left of Welcome to The Asylum. Locate the shallow corner with a bolt about 10ft up. The second pitch offwidth is clearly visible from the road.
